intro: Neottia bifida, commonly known as the divided lady's tresses, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a terrestrial orchid with a slender, creeping rhizome and produces a dense spike of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are arranged in a spiral and have three sepals and three petals, with the lateral sepals being notched, giving it the common name. Neottia bifida is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in association with other orchid species in its native environment.
